message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CL 

The paper proposes a regularization technique for deep neural networks that fully exploits the relationship between samples by constructing a patch-level graph. This technique is applied to enhance two popular regularization strategies, namely Virtual Adversarial Training (VAT) and MixUp, which are commonly used in computer vision and natural language processing tasks. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition), and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Additionally, the paper also mentions experiments on semi-supervised learning, which suggests a possible fit for cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) and cs.CL (Computation and Language).
